summary: Worker fails to reconnect when the Temporal server is initially down, throwing a transport error and stopping retry attempts. Unlike issue #290 which retries after server recovery, this addresses the case where the server is down when the worker starts.
userImpact: Workers crash and stop attempting reconnection when the Temporal server is unavailable at startup, requiring manual intervention to restart the worker once the server is available.
rootCause: Worker startup does not implement retry logic when server is initially down; retry logic was only added for cases where the server becomes unavailable after initial connection (issue #290).
workaround: Implement custom retry logic by wrapping Worker.create or Core.install to handle initial connection failures.
resolutionDetails: The maintainers decided the current behavior (failing fast on misconfiguration rather than leaving workers idle) is intentional and preferred, but remain open to discussion.
keyQuote: We chose not to attempt to reconnect when worker starts to avoid a situation where workers are left idle in case of misconfiguration.
